visual_elements.composition_type: Medium close-up (upper body, face, and arm of woman prominently visible)

human_presence.expressions: Smiling, direct eye contact, approachable and friendly
human_presence.demographics: Adult woman, fair skin, light brown hair, likely healthcare professional (scrubs, watch, earrings)

visual_elements.background_environment: Solid pastel/light green color, no discernible physical environment, clean and simple to keep focus on subject and text

font_characteristics.emphasis: All caps for main message, larger size for 'PREGNANCY TESTING', strong contrast with background
font_characteristics.color: White text on medium purple/violet background, purple text on white for subheading

text_placement_within_frame.subheading: Overlayed in lower section of text box, directly under the main message

thematic_elements.overall_emotional_tone: Reassuring, informative, approachable, slightly urgent due to time emphasis
visual_metaphors_or_symbols: Pregnancy test (universal symbol for pregnancy detection)
Pointing at watch (emphasis on timing/how soon)
clickbait_techniques_employed: Direct question ('HOW EARLY?') that invites curiosity
Visual cues for urgency (alarm clock, pointing at watch)
thematic_elements.brand_elements_present: None overt, but presence of a professional in scrubs strongly aligns with health/medicine/expert branding

visual_reinforcement: Pregnancy test and clock directly represent 'HCG pregnancy testing' and the timing/anticipation (how soon)
Text echoes the video's main question about timing
The presenter’s attire and expression reinforce the authority and reassurance expected from a doctor
contrasts_or_mismatches: No significant contrast or mismatch. Thumbnail is highly aligned with the title, visually and contextually. The only minor difference is the thumbnail says 'How early?' instead of the video's full 'How soon can you know...' phrase, but the meaning is preserved.
